data.text:
NBA

Stoudemire appears headed to Mavs

DALLAS -- Amare Stoudemire asked out of his contract with the New York Knicks because he wants to make a run at a championship.

A person with direct knowledge of the talks said Stoudemire has agreed to sign with the Dallas Mavericks after taking a buyout from the Knicks. He can't make his verbal commitment official until he clears waivers today.

TENNIS

Halep opens Dubai with easy win

DUBAI, United Arab Emirates -- Top-seeded Simona Halep eased to a 6-2, 6-0 win over Daniela Hantuchova at the Dubai Tennis Championships on Tuesday.

Second-seeded Petra Kvitova rallied to defeat Elina Svitolina 2-6, 6-3, 6-2; No. 3 Caroline Wozniacki finally beating Samantha Stosur 4-6, 6-1, 7-5.

More tennis

Sam Querrey, a semifinalist last week in Memphis, injured his back mid-match and retired from the Delray Beach Open while leading Alejandro Gonzalez of Colombia 6-3, 1-2. ... No. 4 seed Fabio Fognini of Italy advanced to the second round of the Rio Open by beating Jiri Vesely of the Czech Republic 6-1, 7-6 (7). No. 3 Tommy Robredo of Spain also advanced. On the women's side in the joint ATP-WTA event, No. 1 Sara Errani of Italy beat Brazilian Teliana Pereira 6-3, 6-3, and No. 3 Roberta Vinci of Italy won 7-6 (4), 6-3 against Lucie Hradecka of the Czech Republic.

GOLF

Love expected

to get Ryder Cup job

LOS ANGELES -- Two people familiar with the decision told The Associated Press late Monday night that the PGA of America has selected Davis Love III as captain for the 2016 matches at Hazeltine.

He is to be introduced on Feb. 24.

Love led the Americans to a 10-6 lead at Medinah in 2012 until Ian Poulter and Europe staged an improbable rally and matched the greatest comeback in Ryder Cup history.

Europe is expected to announce Darren Clarke as its captain.

The Americans have won the Ryder Cup only one time in the past seven tries.

RACQUETBALL

IRT ProAm comes

to Sarasota YMCA

SARASOTA -- Local racquetball players Mike Harmon and Wesley Miller will compete against the top eight pro players in the 2015 Florida IRT ProAm at the Frank Berlin Sarasota YMCA on Feb. 26-28.

Harmon is a five-time national champion, while Miller won three national junior championships by age 12. The event begins on Feb. 26 at 10 a.m. with a men's pro qualifier. The round of 16 matches begin Feb. 27 at 11 a.m., with the men's final set for Feb. 28 at 7 p.m.

ELSEWHERE

Dortmund top pick for Kentucky Derby

With 10 weeks still to go before the May 2 Kentucky Derby, Associated Press named Dortmund, trained by Bob Baffert, as the early favorite. The second favorite is Breeders' Cup Juvenile winner Texas Red, trained by Keith Desormeaux. ... Hyvon Ngetich, 29, of Kenya is being hailed for her grit and determination after she collapsed while running a Texas marathon and crawled the final 300 yards to finish in third place. She had broken from the pack during Sunday's Austin Marathon and was leading late in the race. Race director John Conley says Ngetich began to stagger with about 600 yards to go and later fell. A medical team monitored her as she crawled toward the finish with thousands of spectators cheering her on. At one point she was offered a wheelchair but declined. ... Former Italy soccer coach Arrigo Sacchi is being severely criticized for saying that "there are too many colored players" in the youth sides of Italian clubs, and that is affecting "national pride and identity." Sacchi, who made his comments at an awards ceremony in Montecatini Terme, led Italy to the 1994 World Cup final. ... A group of sore, exhausted but happy players in the Edmonton, Alberta area set an unofficial record for the world's longest hockey game. About 40 skaters played for 250 straight hours, raising more than $800,000 for the Alberta Cancer Foundation. ... Four-time Olympic gold medalist Hayley Wickenheiser, 36, will have season-ending foot surgery and won't play for Canada in the women's world hockey championships next month. She is Canada's all-time leading scorer.

–From wire services
